intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium jurassicum subsp. acrotephraeum, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with pale yellow to brownish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure, which reflect adaptations to its specialized habitat. It is typically found in calcareous soils in specific regions of Europe. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
